examples.driver

Class DemoDeviceDriver

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.java.plugin.Plugin
      • com.tibbo.aggregate.common.plugin.BasePlugin
        • com.tibbo.aggregate.common.device.AbstractDeviceDriver
          • examples.driver.DemoDeviceDriver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DeviceDriver, AggreGatePlugin, java.lang.Comparable<AggreGatePlugin>

    public class DemoDeviceDriver
extends AbstractDeviceDriver
    This demo device driver illustrates the usage of device-provided settings, operations and events. It doesn't communicate with any real hardware, all variables, functions and events are pre-defined.

    • Method Detail

      • setupDeviceContext

        public void setupDeviceContext(DeviceContext deviceContext)
                        throws ContextException
        Description copied from interface: DeviceDriver

        This method is called once during creation of the device context (after device creation and on server startup). Driver implementation usually override it to add definitions of device communication settings (e.g. IP address and port number) to the device context. Setup of synchronization settings for the whole device and individual settings is also performed at this point.

        Variable definitions representing device communication settings should belong to ContextUtils.GROUP_ACCESS variable group.

        Specified by:
        setupDeviceContext in interface DeviceDriver
        Overrides:
        setupDeviceContext in class AbstractDeviceDriver
        Throws:
        ContextException

      • readVariableDefinitions

        public java.util.List<VariableDefinition> readVariableDefinitions(DeviceEntities entities)
                                                           throws ContextException,
                                                                  DeviceException,
                                                                  DisconnectionException
        Description copied from interface: DeviceDriver

        This method should return definitions of device settings (variables). Its implementations may read device metadata or construct the definitions based on server-side device configuration.

        The method is called only if DeviceDriver.isUsesAssets() method returns false.

        Specified by:
        readVariableDefinitions in interface DeviceDriver
        Overrides:
        readVariableDefinitions in class AbstractDeviceDriver
        Parameters:
        entities - Interface allowing to check what variables are active and those definitions should be returned by this method.
        Throws:
        ContextException - If some server-side error occurred
        DeviceException - If device metadata reading failed (e.g. hardware error occurred)
        DisconnectionException - If device connection was interrupted during metadata reading

      • readFunctionDefinitions

        public java.util.List<FunctionDefinition> readFunctionDefinitions(DeviceEntities entities)
                                                           throws ContextException,
                                                                  DeviceException,
                                                                  DisconnectionException
        Description copied from interface: DeviceDriver

        This method should return definitions of device operations (functions). Its implementations may read device metadata or construct the definitions based on server-side device configuration.

        The method is called only if DeviceDriver.isUsesAssets() method returns false.

        Specified by:
        readFunctionDefinitions in interface DeviceDriver
        Overrides:
        readFunctionDefinitions in class AbstractDeviceDriver
        Parameters:
        entities - Interface allowing to check what functions are active and those definitions should be returned by this method.
        Throws:
        ContextException - If some server-side error occurred
        DeviceException - If device metadata reading failed (e.g. hardware error occurred)
        DisconnectionException - If device connection was interrupted during metadata reading

      • readEventDefinitions

        public java.util.List<EventDefinition> readEventDefinitions(DeviceEntities entities)
                                                     throws ContextException,
                                                            DeviceException,
                                                            DisconnectionException
        Description copied from interface: DeviceDriver

        This method should return definitions of events that may be generated by the device. Its implementations may read device metadata or construct the definitions based on server-side device configuration.

        Note, that instances of these events may be generated by the driver asynchronously at any time after at least one device synchronization has finished. This is performed by calling DeviceContext.fireEvent().

        The method is called only if DeviceDriver.isUsesAssets() method returns false.

        Specified by:
        readEventDefinitions in interface DeviceDriver
        Overrides:
        readEventDefinitions in class AbstractDeviceDriver
        Parameters:
        entities - Interface allowing to check what events are active and those definitions should be returned by this method.
        Throws:
        ContextException - If some server-side error occurred
        DeviceException - If device metadata reading failed (e.g. hardware error occurred)
        DisconnectionException - If device connection was interrupted during metadata reading

      • readVariableValue

        public DataTable readVariableValue(VariableDefinition vd,
                                   CallerController caller)
                            throws ContextException,
                                   DeviceException,
                                   DisconnectionException
        Description copied from interface: DeviceDriver
        Implementation of this method should read value of device setting pointed by the argument, convert it to the form of Data Table and return it.
        Specified by:
        readVariableValue in interface DeviceDriver
        Overrides:
        readVariableValue in class AbstractDeviceDriver
        Throws:
        ContextException - If conversion of device value to the Data Table has occurred
        DeviceException - If reading of device setting has failed (e.g. hardware error occurred)
        DisconnectionException - If device connection was lost during operation

      • writeVariableValue

        public void writeVariableValue(VariableDefinition vd,
                               CallerController caller,
                               DataTable value,
                               DataTable deviceValue)
                        throws ContextException,
                               DeviceException,
                               DisconnectionException
        Description copied from interface: DeviceDriver
        Implementation of this method should write server-side value of device setting into a hardware. This method will be called only if device setting definition is writable (e.g server-side changes are allowed.
        Specified by:
        writeVariableValue in interface DeviceDriver
        Overrides:
        writeVariableValue in class AbstractDeviceDriver
        deviceValue - Previous value of setting received from device by calling DeviceDriver.readVariableValue(VariableDefinition, CallerController). Will be NULL if server was restarted since previous read operation or DeviceDriver.isUseDeviceSideValuesCache() returns false;
        Throws:
        ContextException - If conversion of the Data Table to a device value has occurred
        DeviceException - If writing of device setting has failed (e.g. hardware error occurred)
        DisconnectionException - If device connection was lost during operation

      • executeFunction

        public DataTable executeFunction(FunctionDefinition fd,
                                 CallerController caller,
                                 DataTable parameters)
                          throws ContextException,
                                 DeviceException,
                                 DisconnectionException
        Description copied from interface: DeviceDriver
        This method should implement the call of the device-side operation (function). It should decode parameters Data Table to a device native format, pass this input to the device and call requested operation. Opeartion output should be encoded in the form of Data Table and returned by this method
        Specified by:
        executeFunction in interface DeviceDriver
        Overrides:
        executeFunction in class AbstractDeviceDriver
        Throws:
        ContextException - If server-side error occurred (e.g. conversion of input/output between Data Tables and device native format)
        DeviceException - If device-side error occurred
        DisconnectionException - If device connection was lost during operation

      • finishSynchronization

        public void finishSynchronization()
                           throws DeviceException
        Description copied from interface: DeviceDriver
        This method is called in the end of every synchronization. Its implementations may perform some cleanup.
        Specified by:
        finishSynchronization in interface DeviceDriver
        Overrides:
        finishSynchronization in class AbstractDeviceDriver
        Throws:
        DeviceException - If some device communications were performed and error occurred
